reviews.title: Great Stay
reviews.text: The Pros:
- very good location (Georgetown, downtown, Foggy Bottom, DuPont Circle all within a short walk)
reviews.title: Awesome family stay

reviews.text: - very clean, attractive rooms with comfortable beds and HD TV.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great neighborhood

reviews.text: - convenient breakfast buffet included in all nightly rates.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great staff, unruly kids
Embassy Suites - great for families
reviews.text: The Cons:

We just left the Embassy Suites Washington DC after a 3 night stay. It was a great hotel. It was myself and my teenage son. We had a nice, large room. The hotel is in a very good location. It is pretty, has lots of amenities & is in a safe area.
reviews.title: Very safe, friendly, large hotel

likes.liked: — The rooms, the service and the location
likes.disliked: — Internet service was poor & you had to pay for it

reviews.title: Very Happy With this Embassy Suites
reviews.text: Our room was on the 8th floor. We had a nice view of the city west of the hotel. The room itself was large. There is a living room area with a couch, chair, armoir with LCD HD tv, and a table with chairs. It is a large table, like a kitchen table. There is also a wetbar sink, and across from that a frig & microwave, coffee maker in a closet. The bathroom is large and very pretty. There is a separate bedroom area. We had two queen size beds, a dresser with tv on top, and another sink (came in very handy).

The beds were very comfortable, they give you lots of pillows. The towels are also plentiful & fluffy. We had no problems with our room at all. Housekeeping did a great job of emptying our trash, making the beds and supplying new towels.
reviews.title: Really Enjoyed the Embassy Suites - 22nd St NW

likes.liked: — The nice room and the hot breakfast included every morning.
likes.disliked: — Slow elevators and limited cable channels. TV in living room (also no remote) had different channels than bedroom.

reviews.text: There are some fun elevators, they are glass and you can see the entire atrium area as you go up and down. They sometimes take a long time to come, because of the crowds. During peak breakfast time, you may have to wait a lot longer. The atrium area is really pretty. There is a koi pond and other water features. They have lots of tables and chairs to relax and meet people. There are computer stations spread around for everyone to use. The kids pretty much monopolize them, but there is also a business center for adults to use. I had a laptop so I didnt use the business center.
reviews.title: Perfect for Family

reviews.text: The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Every single one we encountered had a great attitude and really wanted to help. The concierge desk lady was so nice, she gave us advice and ideas on a few ocassions. The bellman gave us some ideas of where to eat, they also gave us some directions we asked for. They told us what areas to avoid after dark, and which areas are safer.
reviews.title: We had a wonderful stay here!
This place ROCKS!!!!
reviews.text: This hotel is fabulous!! We got the tip about it from Trip advisor and we are thrilled at the quality for the price we paid.
The hotel is located near the Georgetown section very close to the Metro (4 blocks) It was a very safe area.
reviews.title: Great Stay at the Embassy Suites

reviews.text: We took the Metro to all of the spots. I suggest you buy a multiday metro pass and avoid the Taxi's which are very expensive.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel - Would Definitely Stay Again!!

likes.disliked: — Difficult to get buffet breakfast due to crowds

reviews.text: We took the Amtrak train from Ny and were pleasently surp[rised when the taxi pulled up to this hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel...really nice pool for the kids

reviews.text: The lobby is stunning! There is a cool waterfall and lots of foliage,
reviews.title: Best Staff in DC

reviews.text: Seems like everything always goes smooth here regardless of what time I arrive or leave. Ease of getitng in and out and a comfortable stay. I enjoy coming and staying here!!
reviews.title: Love the eas of the location

reviews.text: We stayed here in June for a long weekend to do some sight-seeing with our family of six (age range of kids - 8 to 20). All in all, an excellent experience for the price paid, especially if traveling with kids. This was a typical Embassy Suites in terms of service (i.e., adequate, not excellent), but for the price, I think it was what I expected. The suite was very clean and nicely decorated, with plenty of room for all of us. The breakfast each morning was very good, with lots of selection. The hotel was very crowded, and the staff did a good job keeping things stocked and clearing tables. We never had to wait for a table. We attended the cocktail hour once, which was nice. We also went to the Italian restaurant once for dinner (Saturday night -- -we had not made reservations anywhere becuase we tried to go to ESPN Zone, but the wait for that was over 2 hours, so we decided to try the hotel restaurant). It was a bit over-priced, but the staff was friendly and everyone enjoyed the food. Not the best meal to be found in DC, but if you find yourself without a reservation, I would definately suggest trying it. As I said above, the hotel was very crowded, but I did not notice any noise once we were in our suite. The location is great -- a short walk to two different Metro lines, which gave us flexibility. Walking distance to Dupont Circle, where we ate a few meals and did some shopping. Really, the only negative that I can think of is that every morning the maid opened the door without knocking (the chain was always on, so she never came all the way in, but it was a disturbing way to be woken every morning!). Over all, a great stay for a great price if you are not expecting anything too fancy.
reviews.title: Great value for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great time at the Embassy Suites. The service was great! Our room was ready early and the breakfast and happy hour is awesome! The hotel is in walking distance of the metro and is a few blocks away from Georgetown. The area was safe and we felt comfortable walking around. We loved all the shops and places to eat in Georgetown.
reviews.title: Loved Embassy Suites!!

reviews.text: The rooms were clean and nice. We liked the fact that you had a bedroom and living room. Also, they had a coffee maker in the room with both coffee and tea. They also gave you shaving cream, razors, and toothpaste if you needed them.
reviews.title: Great Place in the Downtown

reviews.text: My husband and I would stay at this hotel again. Everyone was very nice and we enjoyed our time in D.C. and at the Embassy Suites!
reviews.title: rooms are great but I hope you like kids...and noise

reviews.text: We were a group of friends travelling together and decided that a suite style accommodation would work best for us. This was truely the best value and experience we had on our trip! Newer hotel, nice flat screen (HD TV, I think!), and 3 sinks. The full breakfast (omlette & belgian waffle station plus a full breakfast buffet!) was situated in a beautiful atrium and paid for nearly half our hotel cost itself! Terrific service. On the last day, my friend accidently left her PJ's on the bed and they ended up being taken with the sheets. The housekeeping staff found it and put it with our luggage before we had to depart no problem. We totally recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Best hotel on our trip!
Great Location
reviews.text: We have just returned from 10 days in Washington, this hotel was great and so was the location and the breakfast to. My only negative would have to be the kitchnette, which was a microwave, fridge and coffeemaker. There were no plates, knifes forks etc, so we couldn't really eat in as we had planned. That said there were plenty of cheap eating places near by particularly the Froggy Bottom Pub which was fantastic.

reviews.title: An excellent hotel in a good location
reviews.text: Overall we had a lovely stay here.
The good:
reviews.title: short DC visit

reviews.text: - Rooms are very large
reviews.title: Nice Place

reviews.text: The host hotel for my conference couldn't accommodate us for the duration of our stay so we were happy to find this hotel close by. Not only do the suites make life easier (separate bedrooom so if one of us wants to go to bed early or get up early, there's additional space to hang out), there's an extra sink outside of the bathroom, there's two TVs and lots of outlets for electronics. Best parts though were the included hot breakfast buffet (made to order omelettes, waffles, etc), but the "manager's" evening reception which was any well drink, draft beer or specialty drink they could concoct -- especially friendly staff, snacks that were different each night (veggies and rip, chips, pretzels, nachos w/jalapenos and cheese) and the opportunity to feed the koi (if so inclined). OK, yes, it's a chain and had that kind of Holiday Inn feel with the big atrium and waterfalls and generic room furniture, but the rooms were clean, fairly modern, quiet and again, the staff were especially friendly and unobtrusive. For the money and great location (close to Dupont Circle), I wouldn't trade it for something more typical DC.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations

likes.liked: — included breakfast and evening happy hour

reviews.text: A great bargain hotel esp with the size of suite room and the included big breakfast. Rooms were esp. big, very clean, and the staff very responsive. Would highly recommend esp for families.
reviews.title: A great bargain and a gem

reviews.text: This ranks as our favourite hotel so far on our vacation - according to our children and ourselves.
reviews.title: Great family accommodation

likes.disliked: — Having to pay extra for internet access in our room.

reviews.text: There were lots of holiday makers/ families staying here, but also business people.
reviews.title: Great for Families, central location to metro

likes.liked: — The 2 room suites, Free Breakfast, Cleanliness of Room, Friendliness of Staff, Location

reviews.text: The atrium is a huge hit - great to look at, and the opportunity to feed the fish twice per day is wonderful.
reviews.title: Convenient and Classy Property

reviews.text: First of all, the beds are awesome. The suites are nice in a town where a family of 5 is supposed to be getting 2 rooms. This place saved me a lot of money over 2 rooms, since we were able to put 2 people on each queen bed and one on the pullout sofa.
reviews.title: Perfect Family DC Hotel

reviews.text: We all enjoyed the well done buffet each morning and the snack and drink time each evening. The atrium is wonderful.
reviews.title: There was a Fire-not a joke!!Great Hotel!

reviews.text: The neighborhood is fine even at night. This is an upscale part of DC. The only trouble with an upscale neighborhood is the cost of food. Georgetown is a out the door right at the light and about 6 blocks ahead. Taxis abound everywhere, so when your dogs are sore, lift your arm and woosh you are swept away by one.
reviews.title: Good choice
The food was terrible!
reviews.text: I am very glad I stayed at this hotel. I discerned for 2 full days where I would put my family during our educational spring break, and my vigilence paid off.

reviews.title: Great Family Hotel
reviews.text: The pool is ridiculously small, but there is a small game room connected that made up for it. The workout room was very nice compared to what I have seen at many places I have stayed.
First and foremost, this hotel is great for families. And that is why it's packed with families. If you really don't like children and want a peaceful breakfast, I recommend staying elsewhere.
reviews.title: Good for families

likes.disliked: — Nothing additional for loyal hilton honors vips

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was great, particularly for a family. The buffet was wonderful and the coffee nice and strong the way we like it. Watching the carp swim in the pools while eating breakfast is a lot of fun with young children.
reviews.title: Big rooms, great location

reviews.text: The restaurant on site has terrible service and I don't recommend it because of that reason only. The food was actually decent, if they remember to bring it to you. We went twice and regretted it twice. Other families had the same problems on different days so it wasn't just an isolated experience.
reviews.title: Loved the Beds!

reviews.text: The pool was fun for the kids and they also show movies in the afternoon for kids. Given the outreach to families, I wonder why they don't have a separate play area for younger kids. It would help keep them from running around the atrium.
reviews.title: Can't beat the price and location

likes.liked: — Location and free perks with staying at this resort
likes.disliked: — Lack of drink selecton and moldy bread incident

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a gold vip, I can tell you that there are no additional perks worth discussing (I did get two bottles of water, but for a 4 night stay, that's not much). Not even late checkout when I tried.
reviews.title: Great Hotel! Good Location!

likes.liked: — Great location, good sized room, excellent services.
likes.disliked: — no complaints - I wasn't nuts about the free breakfast but I'm fussy with food. it was also a bit expensive.

reviews.text: Great place to stay to see the sites of Washington. Breakfast is included, but the lines can get long, and if you are a businesss traveller you might get annoyed with all the children running around. The Manager's reception was terrific too. Drinks and munchies from 5:30 to 7 was a great way to end the day.
reviews.title: Awesome for families, great experience!

likes.liked: — Breakfast, happy hour, and big rooms
likes.disliked: — Too far to walk to the National Mall

reviews.text: We wen to "Famous Luigi's" for a pizza dinner and loved it. Highly recommend for the price vs. quality.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: My wife and I ( both 60+) spent 4 nights here in mid June. The hotel was really excellent and would be great for families as well as couples. Suites were spacious with excellent facilities The breakfasts in the atrium were an additional bonus. Dupont Circle was only a short walk away so getting around the city by bus or metro was easy. A very good base in a quiet area, which we would strongly recommend, but don't try to walk to the White House - it's a long long way!
reviews.title: Pretty nice....

reviews.text: PROS:
reviews.title: Look no place else

reviews.text: Kids will love it. They can feed the fish in the hotel lobby. Was not
reviews.title: Great for families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: GREAT HOTEL....very clean hotel and extremely friendly staff. Stayed 3 nights and loved every minute of it. Would DEFINETELY stay there again and would recomend it to anyone else.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: From the friendly staff to the luck of being placed in one of the larger suites, this was the perfect place for a girls' weekend getaway. My 2 friends and I felt extremely at ease in the neighborhood and walked everywhere! We did not dine on site, so I can't really say anything about the Italian restaurant except that it looked like a nice place and the menu prices seemed reasonable. The buffet was typical for ES, so no surprises there. The pool/jacuzzi area was also typical for ES, but not crowded with kids (possibly because of the time of year). It's a pleasant walk to Foggy Bottom metro station just a few blocks away if needed. Also, the hotel is about 4 or 5 blocks from Georgetown, so we visited there a couple of times for shopping and brunch at Martin's Tavern.
reviews.title: Perfect weekend getaway

likes.disliked: — The time of morning they chose to do pool/jacuzzi maintenance

reviews.text: No complaints at all about our suite, which was very large, very clean and had comfortable beds.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.text: Great exercise facility on site!
reviews.title: Perfect!
Good Hotel, Good Location
reviews.text: My only gripe is that the jacuzzi/pool maintenance is performed at a time of morning when I wanted to use those facilities. It would be nice if it could be done during the hours when that area is closed to guests.

Wow, what a great experience! My sister and I stayed at the Embassy Suites in downtown DC in August 2008. Not expecting the Southern hospitality of my hometown, I was quite surprised to find a little bit of "home" while there. The staff was courteous, helpful, and welcoming, The breakfast and afternoon managers reception was such a treat.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience, amazing staff

reviews.text: The hotel was beautiful and very clean. I loved the beds! I had no idea I could sleep so well away from home. The waterfall and lobby were just lovely!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit the DC area for fun or business. It's location is central to many of the main attractions. But most importantly, the staff completes the experience by making everyone feel so welcomed!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel & Great Staff

reviews.text: My son and I stayed here on a weekend trip to DC. We were here about 6 months after it was built. The place was beautiful and very clean.
reviews.title: Really average service

likes.disliked: — The incredibly thin walls (can hear every conversation)

reviews.text: The room was very nice. We had a flat screen in the living room and another TV in the bedroom. The pullout bed in the living room was much better than other hotels I've stayed in. It wasn't fantastic but I didn't hurt my back like those torture devices always do.
reviews.title: Bedbugs

reviews.text: stayed 6 nights. nice hotel, good location clean quiet and in good repair. breakfasts ok but inferior to embassy suite new york where choice and quality superior. liked the coffee machine which produced a huge variety of delicious drinks.
reviews.title: good choice for families

reviews.text: only downside no room safe. security boxes in reception entirely managed by desk staff and minimal security to access (key only)
reviews.title: Well Worth A Visit!

reviews.text: on departure box was not fully emptied by staff and contents had to be sent to my home address by Fedex at my expense.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: i wrote to hotel to raise security issue but nil response to date.
reviews.title: Great place for kids

reviews.text: We had a very nice stay. The room was (executive suite) spacious and modern. The gym, pool, hot tub and sauna were all nice. The breakfast buffet was a real nice add on.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.text: The staff was friendly. It was a bit of a walk to the White House especially considering the wind, but it was not terrible. I found the hotel very kid friendly and highly recommend it.
reviews.title: great place for family
Friendly Staff, Updated decor, Good location!
reviews.text: Great place for family to stay in DC. My kids loved feeding the fish, the pool, the afternoon snacks... Breakfast was very good, although a little crowded. Beds were really nice -- one of the best hotel beds I've seen. The rooms and pool were clean. We really recommend this hotel for a family trip!

reviews.title: Great stay, would highly recommend
reviews.text: Our family of 4 just returned from a long weekend at this Embassy Suites in Wash. DC. It was our first visit to this hotel and we were very pleased. I had selected it based on past tripadvisor reviews and we were not disappointed at all. This hotel is a very friendly and active place -- all the staff we came in contact with had super attitudes and were very helpful. They take pride in their work and it shows.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a regular room -- all are "Suites" - which include one bedroom and a sitting room. The whole place was very clean and had fresh, updated decor -- including fashionable bedcoverings, curtains and furniture. There was a large flatscreen television in the living room portion of the suite plus a sofa (which could convert to sofabed), chair and a small kitchen table with 4 chairs. There was also a small sink in the living room and a small refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, iron/ironing board, and private small safe for valuables.
reviews.title: Great place near DuPont Circle

reviews.text: Our family of 5 stayed for one night. We were in D.C. for a college graduation and some quick sightseeing. The location is the hotel's biggest asset. We walked almost everywhere. The staff were very accommodating with restaurant recommendations and directions. The rooms and amenities were exactly as advertised, but I've stayed in better-maintained Embassy Suites. The Sunday breakfast service was severely understaffed -- some items didn't get replenished for ages. We didn't use the pool, but it was extremely small.
reviews.title: Perfect for Sightseeing Families

reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel this past weekend and had ANOTHER wonderful experience. The staff was friendly and VERY accomodating. The atmosphere is great and the bright open lobby on a sunny day makes you feel like you are on a vacation in a tropical island. I have stayed here about five times now and wouldn't stay anywhere else.
reviews.title: Great location, great service, great hotel

reviews.text: Stayed for 5 nights with our 15 yr old son and was not disappointed. Location great, starbucks outside so I was happy! Suite really huge, we had two double bds in one room but plenty of space. British airways lost all our luggage so we had nothing to check in. Reception staff really great and gave us loads of toiletries to put us on. Complimentary b'fast good. Get there early though as it gets crowded and not too well organizes for that many. Also avoid room service, total disaster. We ordered a meal one night and three hours later still not come! Staff admitted that was a major problem. Location great, we walked everywhere. Was pointless walking to metro as it was over halfway to most places! If I went to washington again, I would definately stay there.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: p.s pool very small!
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.liked: — Great location for seeing the sites in DC.
likes.disliked: — Can not think of anything I did not like about this hotel

reviews.text: Embassy Suites is in a great location for walking to many of the museums and attractions. The rooms are very clean.
reviews.title: Great room and fitness center

likes.disliked: — wish it was closer to Metro

reviews.text: Food at the free breakfast was better than average. The room was a typical embassy suites room with updated feel. Nicer fabrics and granite in the bathroom. The restaurant in the lobby we did not try based on other reviews but love Nooshi, on 19th between L and M. It had great sushi, thai and noodle soups. Pass on Sushi Ko, recommended in Fodors. It was not worth the cab ride. Sala Thai also very good. The staff was always helpful and available.
reviews.title: Great for families

reviews.text: Satyed at this hotel recently with two children.
reviews.title: Great hotel
Nice hotel.
reviews.text: The staff at the hotel are brilliant, always happy and willing to help. The free 'happy hour' from 5:30 to 7:30 provides free drinks, crisps, popcorn ect. The free breakfast is great will cold and hot food, cooked to order!

reviews.title: Top Notch, Highley recommend
reviews.text: The hotel was great as we were able to save money with only having one room but sill have 3 beds! Our room came with a huge LCD television! Rooms are clean and well equiped.
We found that the hotel was close, but not too close to the city centre. The Foggy Bottom metro station was neerest, about 4 blocks walk.
reviews.title: Safe and Convenient Location

reviews.text: Have to "ditto" the previous review on the Embassy Suites. Nice and clean, fine breakfast, and close to the Metro. Very prompt maid service. Also, our first time in DC, with kidz 16,13, and 11... (Think I met Arizona and her family there). Anyway, for the price in DC, location, close to Georgetown and George Washington U. The place is very good. Big enough for 5, as long as you are not in the room too long together. Smallish pool shaped like a U. But free computer terminals to check e-mail, print boarding passes, etc. Would definately stay there again.
reviews.title: "ArizonaTraveler77" Hit it right

reviews.text: Based on reviews we read in Trip Advisor for families travelling with children, we chose the Embassy Suites hotel on 22nd Street (Foggy Bottom area) in Washington DC. We could not have been happier with our choice! We were travelling with our 3 children ages 16, 13, and 6 who had never been to Washington before. The hotel was in a fantastic neighborhood location, a short and easy walk to the subway and with plenty of neighborhood restaurants nearby. We like to use local transportation when we travel, so this was a real plus. Since the room had a seperate living area (with a sofa sleeper), it gave the 5 of us plenty of room to spread out. The room was nicely decorated and very clean. One of the best features, especially from a family perspective is the free breakfast...not a continental breakfast, but a full buffet with lots of choices. They managed to feed a huge number of people, but kept everything stocked and clean. The staff at the hotel was excellent as well, very service oriented and willing to answer all our questions, in fact, one of the bellman took us under his wing and explained the whole subway system to us in detail, which was a big help! We will definitley stay here again and would recommend the hotel to anyone travelling to Washington DC.
reviews.title: Perfect family hotel with a great location

reviews.text: I go to this wonderful hotel every year for my annual "girls' road trip" with some girlfriends and co-workers - and we have never failed to be delighted! While it looks very non-descript from the outside, The Embassy Suites at Dupont Circle is MAGNIFICENT inside: coy pond, water falls, plants and an amazing open atrium make it a hotel that you can just relax in... the lobby is unlike any other hotel I've ever stayed at! It is just beautiful!
reviews.title: The Perfect Place!

reviews.text: Plus, there's a free breakfast (which is GREAT) each morning and a free cocktail party each night.. The hotel has gone through some upgrades recently, too: there's now a waffle maker at breakfast, some extra munchies at the cocktail party and free internet access. Also, we got a call from the hotel restaurant (where we ordered a very nice pizza from) asking if we liked the food. There are just so many nice touches to this hotel - they are TOTALLY customer service oriented. Don't forget your swim suit - there's a lovely indoor pool, too, with a hot tub!
reviews.title: So Glad I Read Trip Advisor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reviews for this hotel are all true and very helpful so I won't repeat everything so far. My husband and I took our 2 daughters in their 20"s....we got a jr.executive suite with 2 queens in the bedroom and a queen sofa bed in the living room....gave the girls the bedroom and slept on the sofa bed which was ok but could use a feather topper on it....Chinese restaurant 2blks away was a bomb...don't go to Meiwah(we are from SF with great Chinese food)...also found out on the last night of our 9 day stay there is a $1 bus that runs every 15 minutes to Georgetown...so after walking all day its nice to ride there...ate at Clyde's and JPauls in Georgetown, at Old Ebbitts Grill by the White House(great) and BSmith's at Union Stations...very fun.....HOTEL is the best for families....we booked thru website of hotel at $330 and the week before we left got $280 on Priceline thru the trip advisor website........never wrote a review before but this was such great advice I had to!!!!!!The friendliest city we have ever been to outside of Ireland....GO!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Highly recommend this Embassy Suites!

likes.liked: — Convenient and safe location, free breakfast and evening reception, free computers in lobby for guests to use anytime they wanted.
